@graph.comment: A single test of an generic interface in a particular state.
A generic interface that tests can be performed on

@graph.label: HTMLPage (web)
@graph.comment: An HTML page that tests can be performed on

The result of a test.
The result of successful a test.
The result of an inapplicable test.
The result of failed a test.
The result of a test that was not completed.
An issue hinders the use of an interface to some degree
An issue that stops users from accessing information or functionality
An issue that can make functionality difficult to use, or content difficult to understand
An issue that can make functionality frustrating to use
An issue that has little to no impact on users
A generic "part" of an interface, such as an element, node, view or component

@graph.label: DOMNode (web)
@graph.comment: A description of a node in the DOM

@graph.label: View (Android)

Fix any of the solutions to resolve the failure
Fix all of the solutions to resolve the failure
A generalised description of one or more areas in a user interface

@graph.label: PageScope (web)
@graph.comment: Describe which elements are included, and which are excluded from the test of an HTML page

@graph.label: Pointer (W3C, Pointers-in-RDF)
@graph.comment: A method that could be used to point out different parts of electronic documents or applications.

@graph.label: Selector (web)
@graph.comment: A CSS Selector of a DOM node, a list of CSS selectors, of iframes ending at a DOM node, or a list of lists of CSS selectors of shadow DOM roots nodes in iframes, ending at a DOM node.
A generalised description of the setup for a test environment

@graph.label: BrowserSetup (web)
@graph.comment: A description of the browser setup
A generic piece of executable code, such as an app, a web page, a command line tool, etc.
Software that identifies accessibility issues, automatically or for user review
A program that initiates a test engine and reports on its results
Some program, or set of programs that has an interface which can be tested for accessibility.
A generic configuration used by a TestEngine

@graph.label: WebSite (web)
@graph.comment: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and available via URLs.
